A file manager is an essential tool in any operating system, and Windows is no exception. While Windows Explorer is the default file manager in Windows, it may not offer all the features that power users demand. This is where third-party file managers like **Tablacus Explorer** come into play.

In this article, we will explore the features of Tablacus Explorer and discuss why it could be a better option than Windows Explorer.

## What is Tablacus Explorer?

Tablacus Explorer is a lightweight and portable file manager for Windows that offers a wide range of customization options, extensive keyboard shortcuts, and plugins to enhance the user experience. It is a free, open-source program that can run on both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows.

## Features of Tablacus Explorer

### Customization

One of the most significant advantages of Tablacus Explorer is its extensive customization options. Users can customize the interface, hotkeys, and menus to fit their specific needs. They can also add or remove buttons in the toolbar, and even make their own custom toolbars.

### Keyboard Shortcuts

Tablacus Explorer has an extensive list of keyboard shortcuts to improve workflow and save time. Users can assign their own shortcuts to any command or menu item through the Options menu.

### Plugins

Tablacus Explorer offers a variety of plugins, which can be downloaded from the program's website. These plugins can extend the functionality of the file manager, such as adding support for new file formats or integrating with other programs. There are also plugins to add new features like a built-in image viewer, FTP client, and clipboard manager.

### Portable

Unlike Windows Explorer, Tablacus Explorer is portable, which means it can be installed and run from a USB drive, making it ideal for people who use multiple computers.

### Tabbed Interface

Tablacus Explorer offers a tabbed interface, allowing users to open multiple tabs and switch between them quickly. This feature is especially useful when moving files between different folders.

## Conclusion

In conclusion, Tablacus Explorer is a feature-rich and customizable file manager that offers a wide range of options that Windows Explorer does not. From a customizable interface to extensive keyboard shortcuts and plug-ins, it can significantly improve workflow and make managing files a breeze.

Moreover, its portability means that users can bring it with them wherever they go, without worrying about installing the program on every computer they use. So, if you're looking for a lightweight, customizable, and portable file manager, give Tablacus Explorer a try.
